alert.note: Alert for Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Texas, eastern Oldham, western Hutchinson, Hansford, Potter, eastern Sherman, Moore and southeastern Hartley Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Hough to 6 miles southwest of Gruver to Wildorado. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Dumas, Guymon, Vega, Fritch, Sunray, Hooker, Goodwell, Gruver, Optima, Hardesty, Hough, Valley De Oro, Boys Ranch, Wildorado, Pringle, Morse, Four Way, Masterson and Lake Meredith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
